Articles.Content: Got this too today. After Toolbar had crashed my game multiple times. Had to delete the cfg file and when I finally got to the main menu, this appeared:
That picture looks creepy. As if they are zombies...

Oh I get it now! It's a weeping angels reference.

Weeping Angels from (TV's hit show) Dr. Who?

Weeping Angels from (TV's hit show) Dr. Who?

Yes, I think he means that. They are similar, not moving while you look at them. Not looking at you. Similar to the ones in Dr.whom.

I just got this. I think it's due to texturereplacer if that's not been figured out yet. I just installed that mod and then loaded up the game and saw this load screen, so I assume the two are related.

I had this 2 screens yesterday multiple times. Had to restart the game couple times due to mod replacing etc... Every third/fourth restart i had this start screen. Yes, have Texturereplacer installed.
I too have Texture Replacer and EVE and I have yet to see this start up screen. I'm kinda jealous...
I have had this screen twice but I don't have Texture Replacer installed. The only major graphical mod I have installed is EVE.
Cmon devs at least tell us if this is intended!!!
I never had the sand-castle pop up in the menus, but I got the new easter-egg last night!

Those kerbals are appearing exactly as if the texture replacer remove helmets when in breathable atmosphere option is on and for some reason is activating at the wrong time. The constant appearance of both EVE and Texture Replacer makes me suspicious.
No some people didnt have texture replacer and some didnt have EVE, Also that dosent explain the shovel

I got this once yesterday.

Closed KSP.

Re-opened.

Got the Mun landing scene, but the normal one.

It's almost certainly an intentional easter egg.

I'm running RO+RSS+etc.

That picture looks creepy. As if they are zombies...

Take a moment to notice that none of the kerbal eyes are facing the camera.
This is a bug I have encountered before. It's when KSP runs out of memory/CPU power. Not and easter egg, the shovel, however. Is not

I have been messing with installing one mod at a time to ensure stability. I have seen this screen atleast 5 times, none of which were with EVE or Texture Replacer (As a matter of fact, I have yet to install those onto .24.2, so there is no way in Kerbal that those mods are causing this.)
OK, is there a single person who has gotten this on a completely stock install?

You know someone tried to debunk the moon landing with the same shadow theory... saw it on Mythbusters .

Whoever set this up should have put a fully-lit kerbal in the shadow of the lander heh.

I just feel like stating the obvious here, but Mythbusters is just a circle jerk. They decide if the myth is bustable or plausible before the filming, and then film to show you the "Fact" they decided on. The entire moon episode shows that so sadly.
I have Jedi, during my above mentioned testing. I dont have any logs or proof to show though, only a few screenshots that dont prove its un-modded.

i have the 64 bit, EVE, FAR, Kethane, Extraplanetary launchpads, texture replacer (i think) toolbar, dmagic orbital science, scansat, mechjeb, and i havnt seen this.

imasa jealous
I do NOT have texture replacer or EVE. I saw those intro screens about 5 times this week.
I had this yesterday, but today it's back to normal. I have EVE and texture replacer.
Does anyone without EVE or Texture Replacer have screenies?
it's part of stock most likely, I had it yesterday. I only have RPM; Joint Reinforcement; and FAR installed
Mu with a simple statement: "Not us."
